intro: Plagiobothrys plurisepaleus, commonly known as the many-sepaled bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. Its unique botanical feature is the presence of multiple sepals, which contribute to its common name. Plagiobothrys plurisepaleus is typically found in moist, rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
